TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager, class System.IServiceProvider
Public Class WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager Implements IDesignerSerializationManager, IServiceProvider
type WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager = class interface IDesignerSerializationManager interface IServiceProvider

Docs.summary: Manages design-time serialization to and from extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) for workflows.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
A workflow or activity designer can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager> to access services useful to managing design-time serialization processes. For example, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager> can be used to create objects, look up types, identify objects, and customize the serialization of particular types.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddSerializationProvider(class System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider provider) cil managed

abstract member AddSerializationProvider : System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider -> unit override this.AddSerializationProvider : System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider -> unit

Docs.summary: Adds the specified serialization provider to the serialization manager.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.AddSerializationProvider%2A> adds a custom serialization provider to the serialization manager. Serialization providers can provide custom serializers for a particular type of object or set of types of objects. During serialization, each custom serialization provider is queried to return a serializer for a specific data type, if it can provide one. The serialization manager uses the custom serializer provided by this method before using the default serializer for a particular type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Context As ContextStack

Docs.summary: Gets a stack-based, user-defined storage area that is useful for communication between serializers.
Docs.value: A that contains information about the current object being serialized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Some serializers require information about the context of an object to correctly persist their state. <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.Context%2A> enables a serializer to set data about the context of an object that it is serializing to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack> where another serializer can access it.

Docs.param: The of the type to load.
Docs.summary: Returns that type associated with the specified XML qualified name.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An XML qualified name is a namespace-qualified local name, in the format of namespace:localname.
Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> objects. It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":"

Docs.exception: contains a null reference ( in Visual Basic).

remarks.format: ## Remarks `errorInformation` can be of any object type. If it is an exception, the message of the exception is extracted and reported to the user. If it is any other type, <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> is called to display the information to the user.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property Properties As PropertyDescriptorCollection Implements IDesignerSerializationManager.Properties

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of properties that can be serialized with available serializers.
Docs.value: A that contains the properties to serialize.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property can contain an empty collection. A serializer should never assume that any properties exist.

MemberSignature.Value: Custom Event ResolveName As ResolveNameEventHandler Implements System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager

Docs.summary: Occurs when cannot locate the specified name in the serialization manager's name table.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event provides a way for a serializer to create an object on demand, so that the serializer does not have to order object creation by dependency. The delegate for this event is cleared immediately after serialization or deserialization is complete.

MemberSignature.Value: Custom Event SerializationComplete As EventHandler Implements System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager

Docs.summary: Occurs when serialization is complete.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This event is raised when serialization or deserialization is complete.
Generally, serialization code is written to emit serialization data and does not typically require state-related checking and processing. If it is necessary to maintain state data throughout serialization, data can be set and accessed by a serializer, which can listen to the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23Serialization%23IDesignerSerializationManager%23SerializationComplete> event, and clear the data after serialization. Restoring the proper state after serialization is important because serializers can be reused during serialization, and leftover state data or open streams might not be correct.
